intro: Ranunculus pensylvanicus, commonly known as the Pennsylvania buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features bright yellow flowers with five petals and a distinctive yellow center, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet having a serrated edge. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and wetlands. The Pennsylvania buttercup is also known for its ability to spread via rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain habitats.
